content.description: Start with hand on right arete and left on horizontal pocket.  Slap the lip and top-out.
content.location: Right 40ft. of the Unity boulder.  Faces downhill towards the tracks.

content.description: Start as for Plop on Top and traverse left through slopes and a shoulder move into the finish of Bippity Bop.  Pretty darn fun.
content.protection: Pads.. 4 ish. And maybe a spot.
content.location: Right to left traverse on the boulder through slopes.  Start on obvious ledge on the right.

content.description: Start low in pit and climb up fun and featured slab.  Easy warm up for the area.

This is a good one if you are into steep, powerful stuff... and it’s not so far from the car.  A nice find by Baker. Start crouched with sidepulls.  A big opening move to a sloper with little edges on it likely leads to some moves left, a tricky foot cut or switch, and then a mantle that you might not want to fall off.
content.protection: A few pads.  Do be wary of the drop off.  Baker accidentally went off it but not while climbing.  We both fell on the first move a lot, and the secondary crux a few moves later and it was safe for us.
content.location: From the Bippity Bop Boulder, Walk uphill to the trees, then cut left 60/70 feet.  A few minute walk away.  Overhanging and facing the lake.

content.description: Start sitting on the right side of the Bippity Bop boulder with a good ledge.  Do a few moves and mantle over with grace.
content.location: Right side of Bippity Bop Boulder.

content.description: Start low with left hand on arete and right under-clinging the boulder.  Set a bicycle with your feet and work way up face.
content.location: Right 40 ft. of the Unity boulder.  Faces downhill towards the tracks.

content.description: Start sitting with a rail and an edge.  Climb the slightly overhanging face, using the arete probably and top out.
content.protection: A few pads and a spot probably.
content.location: Facing the train tracks.  See photo.  A good land mark for finding other boulders in the area.

content.description: Close to the car.. From South Shore Beach Walk the train tracks north. This is the first open talus field you come to. So far there are some cool climbs here. The Balanced Rock Trail will follow you up the hill just to the east about a 100-200 feet away.
